Description: Wire @|Wires are used to direct charge in any direction. Charge will move from a Wire to any available adjacent component, preferring components that have least recently received a charge.
Splitter @|Splitters are used to split a large charge into multiple smaller charges.|Red -> Red|Orange -> 2 Red|Yellow -> 3 Red|Green ->  2 Orage|Blue -> 2 Yellow
Amplifier @|Amplifiers accept two charges and emit a charge that is one level higher than the larger of the receieved charges.

Amplifier - Orange @|Orange Amplifiers accept two charges and emit an orange charge.  It behaves like a normal Amplifier, except that it will not accept a charge that would cause it to produce a lower level charge than orange.

Transmitter - Red @|Transmitters will teleport a charge to the closest Receiver of the same channel.  The possible channels are Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, and Blue. All channels treat all charge levels the same.
Receiver - Red @|Receivers will accept charges from Transmitters of the same channel, and otherwise behave like a normal Wire.
Filter - Red @|Red Filters behave like Wires, except that only red charge is allowed passage.
Hold @|Holds will accept a charge and keep it until the charge has a valid destination to move.
Gate (Open) - Red @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Red Gates are controlled by any Red Switch.
Gate (Closed) - Red @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Red Gates are controlled by any Red Switch.
Switch - Red @|A Red Switch will toggle all Red Doors. It behaves like a normal Wire for the charge.
Chip @|Chips allow you to stuff a 5x5 grid worth of components into a single space. They can be flipped and rotated, as well as copied (c) and pasted (v).
Trap (Open) @|A Trap behaves like a normal Wire for the first charge that passes through it, then it will close.
Trap (Closed) @|A Trap behaves like a normal Wire for the first charge that passes through it, then it will close.
Crank - Gray @|A Gray Crank will open the nearest Gray Trap. It behaves like a normal Wire for the charge.
Power Source - Red @|Red Power Sources produce red charge and send it to adjacent components.
Goal Battery - Red @|Red Goal Batteries need to be filled with charge, and will only accept red charge. Once all goal towers are filled correctly, you win!
Goal - Red|Red Goals need to be filled with red charge.  Once all goal towers are filled correctly, you win!
Blocker|Blockers never allow charge to pass through them.
Pastes the copied chip.
Streamer|NYI
Multiplexer|NYI
Wire - Major Accelerator @|Upgrading to a Major Accelerator causes all charges to pass through this Wire very quickly.
Wire - Minor Accelerator @|Upgrading to a Minor Accelerator causes all charges to pass through this Wire quickly.
Wire - Minor Delay @|Upgrading to a Minor Delay causes all charges to pass through this Wire slowly.
Wire - Major Delay @|Upgrading to a Major Delay causes all charges to pass through this Wire very slowly.

Transmitter - Orange @|Transmitters will teleport a charge to the closest Receiver of the same channel.  The possible channels are Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, and Blue. All channels treat all charge levels the same.

Transmitter - Yellow @|Transmitters will teleport a charge to the closest Receiver of the same channel.  The possible channels are Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, and Blue. All channels treat all charge levels the same.

Transmitter - Green @|Transmitters will teleport a charge to the closest Receiver of the same channel.  The possible channels are Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, and Blue. All channels treat all charge levels the same.

Transmitter - Blue @|Transmitters will teleport a charge to the closest Receiver of the same channel.  The possible channels are Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, and Blue. All channels treat all charge levels the same.
Receiver - Orange @|Receivers will accept charges from Transmitters of the same channel, and otherwise behave like a normal Wire.
Receiver - Yellow @|Receivers will accept charges from Transmitters of the same channel, and otherwise behave like a normal Wire.
Receiver - Green @|Receivers will accept charges from Transmitters of the same channel, and otherwise behave like a normal Wire.
Receiver - Blue @|Receivers will accept charges from Transmitters of the same channel, and otherwise behave like a normal Wire.
Wire @|Wires are used to direct charge in any direction. Charge will move from a Wire to any available adjacent component, preferring components that have least recently received a charge.
Blocker|Blockers never allow charge to pass through them.
Wall|Edge of the chip. Place a component adjacent to the chip to activate the edges. Only Wires and Blockers may be placed on edges.

Amplifier - Yellow @|Yellow Amplifiers accept two charges and emit a yellow charge.  It behaves like a normal Amplifier, except that it will not accept a charge that would cause it to produce a lower level charge than yellow.

Amplifier - Green @|Orange Amplifiers accept two charges and emit a green charge.  It behaves like a normal Amplifier, except that it will not accept a charge that would cause it to produce a lower level charge than green.

Amplifier - Blue @|Orange Amplifiers accept two charges and emit a blue charge.  It behaves like a normal Amplifier, except that it will not accept a charge that would cause it to produce a lower level charge than blue.
Rotates the selected chip 90 degrees clockwise.
Rotates the selected chip 90 degrees counter-clockwise.
Flips the selected chip horizontally.
Flips the selected chip vertically.
Copy the selected chip by presscing (C). Paste by pressing (V).

Power Source - Yellow @|Yellow Power Sources produce yellow charge and send it to adjacent components.
Power Source - Green @|Green Power Sources produce green charge and send it to adjacent components.
Power Source - Blue @|Blue Power Sources produce blue charge and send it to adjacent components.

Filter - Blue @|Blue Filters behave like Wires, except that only red charge is allowed passage.
Goal - Orange|Orange Goals need to be filled with orange charge.  Once all goal towers are filled correctly, you win!
Goal - Yellow|Yellow Goals need to be filled with yellow charge.  Once all goal towers are filled correctly, you win!

Gate (Open) - Yellow @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Yellow Gates are controlled by any Yellow Switch.
Gate (Open) - Green @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Green Gates are controlled by any Green Switch.
Gate (Open) - Blue @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Blue Gates are controlled by any Blue Switch.
Gate (Open) - Gray @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Gray Gates are controlled by nearby Gray Switches.
Gate (Closed) - Orange @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Orange Gates are controlled by any Orange Switch.
Gate (Closed) - Yellow @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Yellow Gates are controlled by any Yellow Switch.

Gate (Closed) - Blue @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Blue Gates are controlled by any Blue Switch.
Gate (Closed) - Gray @|Gates don't allow charge to pass when closed, but behave like Wires when open. Gray Gates are controlled by nearby Gray Switches.
Switch - Orange @|An Orange Switch will toggle all Orange Doors. It behaves like a normal Wire for the charge.
Switch - Yellow @|A Yellow Switch will toggle all Yellow Doors. It behaves like a normal Wire for the charge.
Switch - Green @|A Green Switch will toggle all Green Doors. It behaves like a normal Wire for the charge.
Switch - Blue @|A Blue Switch will toggle all Blue Doors. It behaves like a normal Wire for the charge.
Switch - Gray @|A Gray Switch will toggle only the closest Gray Door. It behaves like a normal Wire for the charge.

Goal Battery - Yellow @|Yellow Goal Batteries need to be filled with charge, and will only accept yellow charge. Once all goal towers are filled correctly, you win!

Goal Battery - Blue @|Blue Goal Batteries need to be filled with charge, and will only accept blue charge. Once all goal towers are filled correctly, you win!
Goal Battery - Omni @|Omni Goal Batteries need to be filled with charge, and will accept any level of charge. Once all goal towers are filled correctly, you win!
